H0.text: Age of the rocks is the basis on which rocks are classified as sedimentary, metamorphic, or igneous.

H1.text: The way the rocks were formed is the basis on which rocks are classified as sedimentary, metamorphic, or igneous.

H2.text: Types of fossils the rocks contain are the basis for classifying rocks as sedimentary, metamorphic, or igneous.

H3.text: Number of minerals found in the rocks is the basis on which rocks are classified as sedimentary, metamorphic, or igneous.

A4.text: Igneous rocks are formed when magma cools in the Earth's crust, or lava cools on the ground surface or the seabed.

A5.text: Sedimentary rocks are formed by diagenesis and lithification of sediments, which in turn are formed by the weathering, transport, and deposition of existing rocks.
